parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions the PSD (Partidul Social Democrat) and encourages voting for them. While it doesn't name a specific candidate, it clearly promotes the party participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The language used ("we", "us", "Romania", "Suceava") and the general appeal to voters suggest a broad target audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters to support the PSD in the upcoming parliamentary elections.  Phrases like "Votează pe 1 Decembrie," "Calea sigură pentru Suceava," and the emphasis on stability and development directly aim to influence voting behavior.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents some political commentary, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic work. It's clearly advocating for a specific political party, not presenting balanced information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a political advertisement promoting a specific party's platform and encouraging voters to support them. The tone is persuasive and promotional, not reflective of a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>489518217471492</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, identified by ad_archive_id 489518217471492, constitutes electoral propaganda.  It directly promotes the PSD party, urging voters to support them in the upcoming parliamentary elections. The post's paid nature, broad reach, and explicit calls to action ("Votează pe 1 Decembrie") clearly indicate an intention to influence the election outcome.  The content goes beyond simply informing the public; it actively advocates for a specific party.  The image further reinforces this by displaying the PSD logo and ballot position.  The post's timing, close to the election, further strengthens the case for it being electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PSD</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PSD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Adrian Tărcă, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID 489518217471492) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care constituie propagandă electorală pentru Partidul Social Democrat (PSD), având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea PSD. Postarea, cu un buget de sub 100 RON, a atins între 1000 și 2000 de impresii, având o estimare a acoperirii de 50.000 - 100.000 de persoane.  Textul postării conține îndemnuri directe la vot ("Votează pe 1 Decembrie"), asociază PSD cu stabilitate și dezvoltare, și prezintă imagini cu logo-ul PSD și poziția pe buletinul de vot, toate acestea constituind elemente de propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.  Contactul advertiserului este aditarca@gmail.com și +40723209623.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
